Job Title: Senior Developer Operations Engineer

Location: Broomfield, CO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
As a Senior DevOps Engineer at Gogo Business Aviation, you will work with the latest Cloud Technologies implementing CI/CD pipelines, developing tools and automation to eliminate manual activities, increase stability, and accelerate our ability to release new functionality. The ideal candidate for this role will have a solid and practical understanding of build systems, version control, and managing and deploying systems at scale. It is essential that you are forward-thinking, eager to learn and have a passion to explore and experiment with the latest technologies. This will be a key role in Engineering directly impacting new applications that rely heavily on the deployment to the cloud.

COME ON BOARD THE GOGO SOFTWARE ENGINEERING TEAM!

How Will You Make a Difference?

Design, develop, maintain, and improve continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines for delivering features, fixes, and system updates in all environments (development, integration, and production) Analyze functional and non-functional business requirements and translate them into tactical plans to deliver CI/CD solutions. Understand the organization’s strategic direction and develop longer term roadmaps to answer these needs Implement continuous monitoring capabilities, track all aspects of the system, infrastructure, performance, application errors and roll up metrics Integrate and implement best practices and DevOps methodologies into every step of the Engineering delivery process Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues Participate/create DevOps culture supporting Engineering’s continuous improvement principles 

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline, or equivalent experience 4-7 years of experience in a DevOps role AWS certification is a REQUIREDThis is a hybrid role: you must be willing to be in the Broomfield office 2-3 days a week 

Required Skills, Experience And Talents

Proficient in build tools such as codebuild and codepipeline Possess a solid understanding of version control systems such as Git; as well as an understanding of Gitflow Experience with AWS services such as CloudFormation, ECS, EC2, S3, Lambda, DynamoDB, VPC, ELB, and auto scaling Infrastructure management and monitoring AWS services (Cloudwatch) Extremely competent in terms of administering Linux systems Familiar with Cloud deployments, containers, and continuous integration Exceptional communication skills and the ability to work independently Able to provision/troubleshoot users and IAM permissions in AWS 

Preferred Skills, Experience And Talents

Knowledge of scripting languages (e.g. Python, Groovy, etc.) Understanding of the Java programming languages and Java frameworks Expertise with cloud security Familiar with Jenkins based CI/CD pipelines with integration with open-source plugins Contact with multi-region deployments and Edge services Transit Gateway, Direct Connect, and site to site VPNs 

We love work-life balance as much as you do! Gogo Business Aviation is a place that values our employees’ time both in and out of the office. Our employees enjoy a hybrid in-office and work-from-home environment that is designed to give you the flexibility and space to collaborate with your team effectively while building the strong relationships that are a hallmark of our culture.

Equal Pay Disclosure(s)

Base Pay:

124,000.00 - 155,000.00 USD Annual

Target Annual Short-Term Incentive:

Bonus Plan at 10% (% of Annualized Base Pay)

Eligible for Incentive Stock Program:

Yes

Benefits:

Gogo offers competitive benefits including medical, dental and vision coverage with plans that can fit each employee’s needs. We offer an immediate vesting 401k plan, paid time off and volunteer time off. Employees have the option to participate in an Employee Stock Purchase Plan. Visit the Careers page on our website for more information at www.gogoair.com/careers.

--- --- ---

Gogo is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, working in compliance with both federal and state laws. We are committed to the concept of Equal Employment opportunity.

Qualified candidates will be considered for employment regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, marital status, medical condition, or disability. 

The EEO is the law and is available here. Gogo participates in E-Verify (English and Spanish). Right to Work Statement (English and Spanish).

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
